com.mopub.common

Class CloseableLayout

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.view.View
      • android.view.ViewGroup
        • android.widget.FrameLayout
          • com.mopub.common.CloseableLayout
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.graphics.drawable.Drawable.Callback, android.view.accessibility.AccessibilityEventSource, android.view.KeyEvent.Callback, android.view.ViewManager, android.view.ViewParent

    public class CloseableLayout
extends android.widget.FrameLayout
    CloseableLayout provides a layout class that shows a close button, and allows setting a CloseableLayout.OnCloseListener. Otherwise CloseableLayout behaves identically to FrameLayout. Rather than adding a button to the view tree, CloseableLayout is designed to draw the close button directly on the canvas and to track MotionEvents on its close region. While marginally more efficient, the main benefit to this is that CloseableLayout can function exactly as a regular FrameLayout without needing to override addView, removeView, removeAllViews, and a host of other methods. You can hide the close button using setCloseVisible(boolean) and change its position using setClosePosition(com.mopub.common.CloseableLayout.ClosePosition).
